entry.title: Waldron’s Outdoor Sports Relocating to Expanded Store on NE Stephens Street
entry.summary: Waldron’s Outdoor Sports in Roseburg is moving to a larger location at 450 NE Stephens Street, opening April 1. The new store will feature an expanded archery range, firearms selection, and fishing section. The current location remains open through March 27 with a blowout sale ahead of the move.

entry.title: Oregon lawmakers share $38 billion budget framework amid federal uncertainty
entry.summary: Proposed federal cuts could blow a multi-billion-dollar hole in the state’s budget Oregon is in a better financial position than other states but could see its budget devastated by federal spending cuts, a framework released Wednesday by the Legislature’s top budget writers shows. The framework, an early step toward adopting the state’s next two-year budget,… The post Oregon lawmakers share $38 billion budget framework amid federal uncertainty appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Oregon needs to build 29,500 more homes each year, chief economist says
entry.summary: Oregon needs to build about 29,500 more homes each year, mostly in the Portland region and Willamette Valley, to emerge from a housing shortage years in the making, the state’s chief economist told lawmakers Monday. The state’s Office of Economic Analysis recently released its first annual housing needs analysis report, with homebuilding targets for the state and… The post Oregon needs to build 29,500 more homes each year, chief economist says appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Oregon’s Unemployment Rate Rises to 4.4% in January
entry.summary: Oregon’s unemployment rate was 4.4% in January and 4.3%, as revised, in December, after rising gradually over the past year from 4.1% in January 2024. Oregon’s 4.4% unemployment rate was the highest since September 2021, when the rate was also 4.4%. The U.S. unemployment rate was 4.1% in December 2024 and 4.0% in January 2025.… The post Oregon’s Unemployment Rate Rises to 4.4% in January appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Galesville Dam Played Critical Role in Preventing Catastrophic Flooding
entry.summary: Galesville Dam helped prevent catastrophic flooding in Douglas County. By managing water levels strategically, officials avoided an uncontrolled spillover, protecting communities from severe damage and highlighting the dam’s critical role in flood control.

entry.title: Bridging the Maintenance Gap: Oregon’s Path to Safe, Reliable Travel
entry.summary: Oregon’s aging bridge inventory is a growing concern for ODOT’s Bridge Program, in particular the Interstate Era bridges. entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAILED A FUGITIVE ON SATURDAY MORNING
entry.summary: March 17, 2025 10:30 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a fugitive on Saturday morning. An RPD report said shortly after 11:00 a.m. officers contacted the 41-year-old at a business in the 1900 block of Northwest Mulholland Drive for trespassing. Officers discovered the man had a statewide warrant for a parole violation. He was taken into custody...

entry.title: SEWAGE BY-PASS IN SUTHERLIN DUE TO STORM
entry.summary: March 17, 2025 10:10 a.m. Due to an excessive amount of rainfall in the 48 hours ending Monday morning, the City of Sutherlin wastewater system was inundated by storm water causing several manholes throughout the city to experience sanitary sewer overflows, overflowing raw sewage and storm water to storm drains that discharge to Sutherlin Creek....

entry.title: ANNUAL HYDRANT FLUSHING BEGINS ON APRIL 1ST
entry.summary: March 17, 2025 9:50 a.m. The Roseburg Fire Department will be flushing fire hydrants inside the city limits of Roseburg from April 1st through June 30th. Fire Chief Tyler Christopherson said hydrant flushing will take place from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., seven days a week. A city release said RFD realizes that hydrant flushing...

entry.title: DEER CREEK AT ROSEBURG HITS ALL TIME HIGH CREST
entry.summary: March 17, 2025 9:30 a.m. Sunday’s rain led to Deer Creek in southeast Roseburg reaching an all-time high crest of 15.93 feet. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said the peak was achieved at 3:45 p.m. The previous record crest for Deer Creek was 15.4 feet, which took place on December 6th, 1981. Sunday afternoon...

entry.title: History on wheels

entry.title: Shamrock Quest
entry.summary: The Boys and Girls Club of the Umpqua Valley hosted Thundering Water’s second annual Shamrock Quest on Saturday, packing the place with families and as much green as an Oregon Ducks pregame gathering.

entry.title: Record-Breaking Snowfall at Crater Lake in 2025
entry.summary: Crater Lake saw 27.0 inches of snowfall yesterday, pushing 2025’s total to a record 168 inches—the most ever in a year. Strong winter storms and an atmospheric river system have fueled the extreme snowfall, marking one of the most significant weather events in the area's history.

entry.title: Roseburg Experiences Wettest March Day on Record
entry.summary: Roseburg saw its wettest March day ever, with 3.47 inches of rain Sunday, surpassing the 2012 record of 2.29 inches. March 16 also set a new daily record, beating an 88-year-old high. With over half the month left, this March is already the third-wettest in history.

entry.title: COUNTY FLOODING EVENT UPDATE
entry.summary: March 17, 2025 4:10 a.m. It was a day that will be remembered for years in Douglas County. Sunday brought flooding, mudslides, road closures, people trapped, evacuations and more.
